titleStmt.title: The coppy of a letter of Father Philips, the Queens confessor, which was thought to be sent into France, to Mr. Mountagues discovered and produced to be read in the House of Commons, by Mr. Pymme the 25 of June, 1641 to this effect : lamentably complaining of the times and present state of things and this was written presently after Piercy and Jermyn fled.
titleStmt.author: Philips, Robert, d. 1650?

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
